tool_call: contentManager_createContent
arguments: {"context": {"sessionId": "session_1731710000000_i7j8k9l0m", "workspaceId": "ws_1731710000000_n1o2p3q4r", "sessionDescription": "Creating review checklist", "sessionMemory": "Process documentation", "toolContext": "Checklist creation", "primaryGoal": "Standardize code reviews", "subgoal": "Create checklist"}, "filePath": "/docs/development/code-review-checklist.md", "content": "# Code Review Checklist

## Before Submitting PR

### Code Quality
- [ ] Code follows style guide and passes linter
- [ ] No commented-out code (use git history instead)
- [ ] No console.log or debug statements
- [ ] Variables and functions have meaningful names
- [ ] Complex logic has explanatory comments
- [ ] No magic numbers (use named constants)
- [ ] No duplicate code (DRY principle)

### Functionality
- [ ] Feature works as intended
- [ ] Edge cases handled
- [ ] Error handling implemented
- [ ] Input validation added
- [ ] No breaking changes (or documented)

### Testing
- [ ] Unit tests added/updated
- [ ] All tests pass locally
- [ ] Test coverage >80%
- [ ] Integration tests for APIs
- [ ] Manual testing completed

### Security
- [ ] No hardcoded secrets or credentials
- [ ] Input sanitized (prevent XSS)
- [ ] SQL queries parameterized (prevent injection)
- [ ] Authentication/authorization checks
- [ ] Sensitive data encrypted
- [ ] HTTPS enforced for external calls

### Performance
- [ ] No N+1 queries
- [ ] Database queries optimized with indexes
- [ ] Large lists paginated
- [ ] Heavy operations run async
- [ ] Caching implemented where appropriate

### Documentation
- [ ] README updated if needed
- [ ] API docs updated
- [ ] JSDoc/TSDoc comments for public functions
- [ ] Changelog entry added
- [ ] Migration guide (if breaking changes)

## During Review

### Architecture
- [ ] Changes fit overall architecture
- [ ] No unnecessary dependencies added
- [ ] Proper separation of concerns
- [ ] Reusable components identified
- [ ] Tech debt documented

### Code Review
- [ ] Logic is clear and maintainable
- [ ] No overly complex functions (>50 lines)
- [ ] Proper error handling
- [ ] Resource cleanup (connections, files)
- [ ] Concurrency issues addressed

### Testing Review
- [ ] Tests are meaningful
- [ ] Tests cover edge cases
- [ ] Tests are not flaky
- [ ] Mock usage is appropriate

### Git Hygiene
- [ ] Commits are logical units
- [ ] Commit messages are descriptive
- [ ] No merge commits in PR
- [ ] Branch is up to date with base

## Review Guidelines

### For Reviewers

1. **Be constructive**: Suggest improvements, don't just criticize
2. **Be specific**: Reference line numbers and provide examples
3. **Prioritize**: Mark critical vs. optional changes
4. **Ask questions**: If something is unclear, ask for clarification
5. **Acknowledge good work**: Comment on well-written code
6. **Be timely**: Review within 24 hours

### Review Comments Types

- **MUST**: Critical issue, must be fixed
- **SHOULD**: Important improvement recommended
- **NIT**: Minor style/preference issue
- **QUESTION**: Seeking clarification
- **FYI**: Informational, no action needed

### Response Time SLAs

- **Critical fixes**: 2 hours
- **Standard PRs**: 24 hours
- **Large refactors**: 48 hours

## Post-Merge

- [ ] Delete feature branch
- [ ] Monitor deployment
- [ ] Verify in production
- [ ] Close related issues
- [ ] Update project board"}

tool_call: contentManager_createContent
arguments: {"context": {"sessionId": "session_1731715000000_m3n4o5p6q", "workspaceId": "ws_1731715000000_r7s8t9u0v", "sessionDescription": "Creating dashboard docs", "sessionMemory": "Operations documentation", "toolContext": "Guide creation", "primaryGoal": "Document monitoring", "subgoal": "Create dashboard guide"}, "filePath": "/docs/operations/monitoring-dashboard.md", "content": "# Monitoring Dashboard Guide

## Overview

Our monitoring dashboard provides real-time visibility into system health and performance.

## Access

- **URL**: https://monitoring.example.com
- **SSO**: Enabled via Okta
- **Permissions**: View (all), Edit (devops), Admin (leads)

## Dashboard Sections

### 1. System Health

**Metrics Displayed:**
- Overall system status (healthy/degraded/down)
- Service availability (%)
- Active incidents count
- Mean time to recovery (MTTR)

**Alerts:**
- üî¥ Red: Critical issues requiring immediate action
- üü° Yellow: Warnings requiring attention
- üü¢ Green: All systems operational

### 2. Performance Metrics

**Response Times:**
- P50: 50th percentile
- P95: 95th percentile
- P99: 99th percentile
- Max: Maximum response time

**Throughput:**
- Requests per second (RPS)
- Peak RPS
- Average RPS (1h, 24h, 7d)

**Error Rates:**
- 4xx errors (client)
- 5xx errors (server)
- Error rate percentage

### 3. Infrastructure

**Compute:**
- CPU usage (%)
- Memory usage (%)
- Disk usage (%)
- Network I/O

**Database:**
- Query performance
- Connection pool usage
- Slow queries
- Replication lag

**Cache:**
- Hit rate (%)
- Miss rate (%)
- Eviction rate
- Memory usage

### 4. Application Metrics

**User Activity:**
- Active users
- New signups
- Session duration
- Page views

**Business Metrics:**
- Transactions per minute
- Revenue (hourly, daily)
- Conversion rate
- Cart abandonment rate

## Custom Views

### Creating Custom Dashboard

1. Click "New Dashboard"
2. Select metrics to display
3. Choose visualization type
4. Set time range
5. Save and share

### Sharing Dashboards

- Copy dashboard URL
- Set permissions (view/edit)
- Schedule email reports

## Alerts Configuration

### Creating Alerts

```yaml
alert:
  name: High Error Rate
  condition: error_rate > 5%
  duration: 5m
  severity: critical
  channels:
    - slack:#alerts
    - email:oncall@example.com
    - pagerduty:P123456
```

### Alert Severity Levels

1. **Critical**: Immediate response required (page on-call)
2. **High**: Attention within 30 minutes
3. **Medium**: Review within 2 hours
4. **Low**: Review next business day

## Time Range Selection

- Last 15 minutes
- Last hour
- Last 24 hours
- Last 7 days
- Last 30 days
- Custom range

## Filtering & Search

**Filter by:**
- Environment (prod, staging, dev)
- Service name
- Region
- Version

**Search:**
- Use query syntax: `service:api AND status:error`
- Wildcards: `service:api-*`
- Regex: `service:/api-.*/`

## Common Scenarios

### Investigating High Response Times

1. Check Performance ‚Üí Response Times
2. Identify affected endpoints
3. Review Database ‚Üí Slow Queries
4. Check Infrastructure ‚Üí CPU/Memory
5. Correlate with recent deployments

### Debugging Error Spike

1. Check System Health ‚Üí Error Rates
2. Filter by error code (4xx vs 5xx)
3. View error logs
4. Identify common patterns
5. Check recent changes

### Capacity Planning

1. View Infrastructure metrics
2. Select 30-day time range
3. Identify trends
4. Project growth
5. Plan scaling

## Integrations

### Slack
- Real-time alerts
- Daily summaries
- Incident updates

### PagerDuty
- Critical alerts
- On-call routing
- Escalation policies

### Jira
- Auto-create incidents
- Link to deployments
- Track remediation

## Best Practices

1. **Check daily**: Review dashboard each morning
2. **Set meaningful alerts**: Avoid alert fatigue
3. **Use annotations**: Mark deployments and incidents
4. **Share context**: Comment on anomalies
5. **Regular reviews**: Update thresholds quarterly

## Troubleshooting

### Dashboard Not Loading
- Check VPN connection
- Clear browser cache
- Try incognito mode
- Contact devops if persists

### Missing Metrics
- Verify service is sending metrics
- Check time range selection
- Verify permissions
- Check data retention policy

## Resources

- [Metrics Glossary](/docs/metrics-glossary.md)
- [Alert Runbooks](/docs/runbooks/)
- [On-Call Guide](/docs/oncall-guide.md)
- [Support Slack: #monitoring](slack://channel)"}

tool_call: contentManager_createContent arguments: {"context": {"sessionId": "session_1731718600000_l7m8n9o0p", "workspaceId": "ws_1731718600000_q1r2s3t4u", "sessionDescription": "Creating a11y guide", "sessionMemory": "Accessibility documentation", "toolContext": "Guide creation", "primaryGoal": "Document a11y testing", "subgoal": "Create testing guide"}, "filePath": "/docs/testing/accessibility.md", "content": "# Accessibility Testing Guide ## Overview Ensure our application is accessible to all users, including those with disabilities. ## WCAG Guidelines We follow **WCAG 2.1 Level AA** standards. ### Key Principles (POUR) 1. **Perceivable**: Information must be presentable to users 2. **Operable**: UI must be navigable 3. **Understandable**: Information and operation must be clear 4. **Robust**: Content must work with assistive technologies ## Testing Checklist ### Keyboard Navigation - [ ] All interactive elements accessible via keyboard - [ ] Logical tab order - [ ] Visible focus indicators - [ ] Skip links for main content - [ ] No keyboard traps - [ ] Custom widgets support arrow keys **Test**: ``` 1. Tab through entire page 2. Use arrow keys on custom components 3. Check focus is always visible 4. Verify Enter/Space activate buttons ``` ### Screen Reader - [ ] Semantic HTML (headings, landmarks, lists) - [ ] Alternative text for images - [ ] Labels for form inputs - [ ] ARIA attributes when needed - [ ] Announced dynamic content - [ ] Meaningful link text (no "click here") **Test with**: - NVDA (Windows) - JAWS (Windows) - VoiceOver (Mac/iOS) - TalkBack (Android) ### Color & Contrast - [ ] Text contrast ratio ‚â• 4.5:1 - [ ] Large text contrast ‚â• 3:1 - [ ] Information not conveyed by color alone - [ ] Focus indicators have 3:1 contrast **Tools**: - Chrome DevTools Color Picker - WebAIM Contrast Checker - axe DevTools ### Responsive & Zoom - [ ] Functional at 200% zoom - [ ] Text reflow (no horizontal scrolling) - [ ] Touch targets ‚â• 44√ó44 pixels - [ ] Orientation support (portrait/landscape) ### Forms - [ ] Labels associated with inputs - [ ] Error messages clear and accessible - [ ] Required fields indicated - [ ] Validation errors announced - [ ] Fieldsets for grouped inputs ```html Please enter a valid email ``` ### Images ```html
Detailed description of architecture...
``` ### ARIA Usage **When to use ARIA:** - Custom widgets (tabs, accordions, modals) - Dynamic content updates - Application-like interfaces **First Rule of ARIA:** Don't use ARIA if semantic HTML works. ```html
Click
``` **Common ARIA patterns:** ```html

Dialog Title

Content...
Notification message
``` ## Automated Testing ### axe-core ```javascript import { axe } from 'jest-axe'; test('should have no accessibility violations', async () => { const { container } = render(); const results = await axe(container); expect(results).toHaveNoViolations(); }); ``` ### Playwright ```javascript import { test, expect } from '@playwright/test'; import AxeBuilder from '@axe-core/playwright'; test('should not have accessibility issues', async ({ page }) => { await page.goto('/'); const results = await new AxeBuilder({ page }).analyze(); expect(results.violations).toEqual([]); }); ``` ### ESLint Plugin ```bash npm install eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y ``` ```json { "extends": ["plugin:jsx-a11y/recommended"] } ``` ## Manual Testing Process ### 1. Keyboard Test 1. Tab through page 2. Activate all interactive elements 3. Check focus visibility 4. Test custom keyboard shortcuts ### 2. Screen Reader Test 1. Navigate by headings (H key) 2. Navigate by landmarks (D key) 3. Read all content 4. Test forms ### 3. Zoom Test 1. Zoom to 200% 2. Check text reflow 3. Verify functionality ### 4. Color Test 1. Check contrast 2. Test in grayscale 3. Verify color blindness modes ## Common Issues & Fixes ### Missing Alt Text ```html ``` ### Missing Form Labels ```html ``` ### Poor Color Contrast ```css /* ‚ùå Bad - 3:1 contrast */ color: #777; background: #fff; /* ‚úÖ Good - 4.5:1 contrast */ color: #595959; background: #fff; ``` ### Inaccessible Modals ```javascript // ‚úÖ Good modal - Trap focus inside modal - Close on Escape - Return focus on close - aria-modal="true" - Announce modal title ``` ## Testing Tools ### Browser Extensions - axe DevTools - WAVE - Lighthouse - Arc Toolkit ### Screen Readers - NVDA (Free, Windows) - JAWS (Windows) - VoiceOver (Mac/iOS, built-in) - TalkBack (Android, built-in) ### Command Line ```bash # Pa11y npm install -g pa11y pa11y https://example.com # Lighthouse CI npm install -g @lhci/cli lhci autorun ``` ## Resources - [WCAG Guidelines](https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/quickref/) - [MDN Accessibility](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility) - [WebAIM](https://webaim.org/) - [A11y Project](https://www.a11yproject.com/) - [Inclusive Components](https://inclusive-components.design/)"} Result: {"created": true, "filePath": "/docs/testing/accessibility.md", "size": 5678} Created comprehensive accessibility testing guide covering WCAG guidelines, testing checklists, ARIA usage, automated testing, and common issues.
